name: Grilled Lamb Loin Chops
author: France C
summary: Don't let their small size fool you, these chops are packed with maximum flavor! Try and find loin chops that are at least 1-inch thick for best results. These are best served medium to medium-rare, but add a few extra minutes per side if you prefer them a little more done.
ingredients: 1 pinch salt and freshly ground black pepper
directions: Combine herbes de Provence, olive oil, garlic, and lemon juice in a small bowl
Rub mixture over lamb chops and refrigerate for at least 1 hour
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate
Season chops with salt and pepper
Place chops on the preheated grill and cook until browned and medium-rare on the inside, 3 to 4 minutes per side
Remove from grill and place on an aluminum foil-covered plate to rest for 5 minutes before serving
